Lu Zhishen Review: The Flowery Monk of Critical Hits | Empires & Puzzles
Meet Lu Zhishen, the Flowery Monk who believes inner peace is best achieved by smashing everyone with a tree trunk. With ramping damage and critical hits that heal, he is a red wrecking ball.
Lu Zhishen: The Monk Who Dunks on Your Entire Team
Lu Zhishen: The Flowery Monk Who Preaches with a Tree Trunk

Lu Zhishen, known as the "Flowery Monk of Water Margin," is a 5-star Fire hero from the Outlaws of Liangshan family, released in late August 2025. He isn't your typical serene, meditating monk. Instead, he embodies the "aggressive negotiations" style of diplomacy, wielding a massive tree trunk and a kit designed to obliterate enemy teams with critical hits. As a Monk class hero, he naturally resists negative status effects, which fits his unstoppable persona perfectly. He occupies a unique space as a heavy hitting AoE damage dealer who also functions as a pseudo healer and team buffer, bridging the gap between pure offense and sustain.

Lu Zhishen’s design is a striking representation of his lore. He is depicted as a burly, bearded warrior monk, adorned with massive prayer beads and traditional tattoos that give him his "Flowery" nickname. The standout element is, of course, the entire uprooted tree he casually carries on his shoulder like a baseball bat. It is a fantastic visual cue for the brute force he brings to the battlefield. The color palette is dominated by earthy reds and browns, grounding him as a Fire hero, while the dynamic pose suggests he is mid stride, ready to introduce that tree to someone's face.

Lu Zhishen enters the arena with a Power of 1232, which, while impressive, is starting to see the very first signs of being outpaced by the absolute bleeding edge heroes of December 2025 (who are pushing 1260+). His Attack stat of 1277 is excellent, ensuring his special skill hits with significant force. His Defense (1240) and Health (2239) are well balanced, making him sturdy enough to survive until he can fire. In the current landscape, his stats are firmly in the upper echelon, competitive with almost anything outside of the very newest Opulent or Astral releases.

"Restraint" is clearly ironic here. This skill is a multi layered offensive nuke. First, it deals a solid 340% damage to all enemies at Average speed. While 340% might sound standard, the critical hit mechanic elevates it significantly. The skill has a chance to deal critical hits based on his overall crit chance (boosted heavily by his family bonus). These crits deal 50% more damage and can reduce max health in PvP.
The second part of the skill is a terrifying ramp up mechanic. After casting, he gains +40% power for his

special skill, and this bonus grows by 30% every turn he holds it, capping at +130%. This turns him into a ticking time bomb. If the fight drags on and he fires a second time, he isn't just hitting you; he is deleting you. Finally, the team wide +40% critical chance buff ensures his allies also join the beatdown.
Average. He requires 10 tiles to charge, or 9 with a level 23 Mana Troop (or equivalent bonuses).
With a base attack of 1277 and a 340% multiplier, he deals roughly 4,341 raw damage before defense reduction. If a hit crits (1.5x damage), that raw number jumps to ~6,511.

If he fires a second time with the maximum +130% power boost (totaling +170% if we consider the base 40 + ramp), the multiplier effectively skyrockets. A 340% hit boosted by massive power modifiers is extinction level event territory.
His passive heals 10% of max health per critical hit instance (capped once per turn). With 5 enemies, he has 5 chances to trigger a crit, making the heal highly reliable when he fires.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Outlaws of Liangshan family is all about critical hits, and Lu Zhishen is the poster child for this mechanic.

The family bonus provides a flat +50% (for 1 hero) up to +70% (for 3 heroes) critical chance. This is massive. It means Lu Zhishen essentially has a coin flip's chance (or better) to deal 1.5x damage on every tile and every special skill hit without any outside help.
This is his sustain engine. Since his family bonus gives him a high crit chance, he will almost certainly heal the team for 10% boosted health every time he fires his special.

This passive rewards him for "punching up." Gaining 20% boosted health when hitting a healthier enemy helps him stabilize, while gaining 20% mana when hit by a healthier enemy acts as a fantastic catch up mechanic, potentially letting him fire sooner than expected.
A situational but welcome immunity, especially against Barbarian heavy teams or specific bleed inducing heroes.

grants him defense that increases every time he is hit for the first 6 turns. While reliable, many players (and I agree) would have preferred something more offensive like Rage or Attack Up to lean into his "one shot" potential. However, Bulwark does ensure he lives long enough to deliver his second, ramped up payload.

Upon release, Lu Zhishen was immediately recognized as a powerhouse, particularly for the "Crit Meta" that the Outlaws family introduced. He was part of the wave that made critical hits a central strategy rather than just a nice bonus for tile damage.

Despite being a few months old, his stats are fresh. His mechanics—specifically the ramping damage and max health reduction on crits—are future proof. Raw damage dealers often fade, but ones that can scale up to +130% extra power have a much longer shelf life.

He is highly viable. In Rush wars, he is a monster. In standard PvP, he forces the opponent to deal with him quickly before his damage ramps up. He hasn't been relegated to a niche; he is a premier Fire damage dealer.
Lu Zhishen is a damage dealer first and foremost. While his stats are balanced, his job is to end the fight.
Maximizes the damage output of his AoE hit and takes full advantage of the critical damage multiplier. Every point of attack is worth 1.5x when he crits.
Slightly less survivable, though Bulwark and his self healing passives mitigate this.
Enhances his survivability, ensuring he can survive to fire that devastating second shot.
Sacrifices significant kill pressure on the first activation.
(Attack focus) path is the way to go. If you aren't killing them with a tree, you aren't using him right.
340% to all at Average speed is already good; adding critical hits makes it great.
The threat of a second, powered up cast forces opponents to prioritize him or risk a total wipe.
He heals the team (boosted health) when he crits and heals himself when hitting high HP enemies.
The +40% Crit Chance buff for all allies dramatically increases tile damage and special skill damage for the whole team.
While the odds are in his favor, relying on critical hits means there is always a small chance he just hits "normally" and feels underwhelming.
In a Fast/Very Fast meta, Average speed heroes can sometimes die before firing, especially without mana troops.
His crit buff and the ramping power can be dispelled (though the power ramp is internal to the caster usually, the crit buff is dispellable).
He is absolutely devastating here. Firing 340% AoE repeatedly with crit chances is a nightmare for attackers.
His ability to boost health and deal high damage to waves makes him excellent for auto farming and hard map stages.
He sits well at Flank or Tank, punishing bad boards with his passive mana gain and threatening a team wipe.
Lu Zhishen shines when paired with heroes who can exploit his crit buff or help him survive to fire twice.
. Stacking Outlaw family members pushes the base crit chance to 70%. With Lu's buff, the team essentially has 100% crit chance on everything.
. Phenexa resets buff durations and boosts damage, while Gestalt benefits from the softening up Lu provides.
. Hathor provides ailment immunity and overheal, ensuring Lu stays clean and healthy enough to ramp up his damage.
Heroes or passives that prevent critical hits (like some Kalevala heroes or specific tanks) neuter a large part of his kit.
who keep his mana down prevent him from ever reaching that second, powered up state.
Hitting 5 enemies for massive damage is great, until you hit a

If you pulled Lu Zhishen early, rejoice. He will carry you through map stages and raids. Focus on keeping him alive with healers. Don't worry too much about the complex passives; just fire him and watch things break.

Lu Zhishen is worthy of Limit Break 2 solely for the stats, even if Bulwark isn't the flashiest Alpha Power. His value in Rush Wars and as a "hammer" in attack teams is high. However, if you already have a maxed
or similar heavy hitting Reds, compare their roles. Lu offers more team utility via the crit buff than pure selfish damage dealers.
The community reaction to Lu Zhishen was a mix of awe and fear.
"This guy's a monster... essentially hit all for 700% on second charge." - A terrified forum user.
"Sword 100%... if you pull this guy, congratulations." - A YouTuber's verdict.
There was significant debate about whether he needed other Outlaw family members to be good. The consensus settled on: "He makes them better, but he doesn't need them to be great."
Players also noted the synergy with
, creating a "two G's that slap hard" combo.

Lu Zhishen is a chaotic force of nature. He brings the raw damage of a sniper to an AoE skill, adds healing utility, and buffs his team's tile damage significantly. While he relies slightly on the RNG of critical hits, the odds are heavily stacked in his favor. He is not a subtle hero; he is a blunt instrument designed to end matches.
If you have him, level him. If you face him, bring a dispeller or pray.
A top-tier damage dealer who keeps the team healthy while smashing the opposition. A flowering success.
